title: Zvi Markus
text:
Zvi (Zvika) Markus ( or צביקה מרקוס) is a former <a href="Israel">Israel</a>i footballer who played for <a href="Hapoel%20Petah%20Tikva%20F.C.">Hapoel Petah Tikva</a> and <a href="Hapoel%20Kfar%20Saba%20F.C.">Hapoel Kfar Saba</a>.
Career.
Born in Tel Aviv to football referee Moshe Markus, Zvika moved with his family to Petah Tikva in 1948, where he joined <a href="Hapoel%20Petah%20Tikva%20F.C.">Hapoel Petah Tikva</a>. In 1955 Markus was promoted to the first team, and was part of the championship winning team in <a href="1954%E2%80%9355%20Liga%20Alef">1954–55</a>, scoring his first goal for the team in a <a href="Israel%20State%20Cup">cup</a> match against <a href="Hapoel%20Nahariya%20F.C.">Hapoel Nahariya</a>, and a <a href="hat-trick">hat-trick</a> in a league match against <a href="Hapoel%20Balfouria%20F.C.">Hapoel Balfouria</a>. On 21 April 1956, in a league match against <a href="Hapoel%20Tel%20Aviv%20F.C.">Hapoel Tel Aviv</a> Markus was injured, which took over a year to recover from, returning to the team at the beginning of the <a href="1958%E2%80%9359%20Hapoel%20Petah%20Tikva%20F.C.%20season">1958–59 season</a>.
Markus stayed with Hapoel Petah Tikva until the end of the <a href="1963%E2%80%9364%20Hapoel%20Petah%20Tikva%20F.C.%20season">1963–64 season</a>, winning five championships with the team. At the beginning of the <a href="1964%E2%80%9365%20in%20Israeli%20football">1964–65</a> Markus transferred to <a href="Hapoel%20Kfar%20Saba%20F.C.">Hapoel Kfar Saba</a>, with which he played in <a href="Liga%20Alef">Liga Alef</a> (second division) for the next two seasons, retiring at the end of the <a href="1965%E2%80%9366%20in%20Israeli%20football">1965–66</a> season.
Personal life.
Markus is married to Carmela Bek, daughter of Haim and Rachel Bek, owners of Pitu'ach Hotel in <a href="Ra%27anana">Ra'anana</a>. The two met while Markus was staying at the hotel with Hapoel Petah Tikva ahead of the <a href="1954%E2%80%9355%20Israel%20State%20Cup">1954–55 Israel State Cup</a> final, Bek was 10 years old at the time. When Bek reached the age of 18, she contacted Markus through a footballer who moved from Hapoel Petah Tikva to <a href="Hapoel%20Ra%27anana%20A.F.C.">Hapoel Ra'anana</a>, and the two later married and had three children.
